name: Peppers Beach Club & Spa

reviews.text: After reading some of the reviews on here, we were a little disappointed with the Beach Club. The service on occasions was extremely poor. We arrived a little too early to check in so the receptionist promised to call my mobile when it was ready - three hours later still no call so we went back to reception to be told our room had been ready for two and a half hours! Not a good start. Twice we had to request laundry detergent for our room; on the second occasion I noticed a list of jobs requested by guests at reception, many with "third request" next to them - even things like "toilet not working properly". Most appalling of all was when the cleaners failed to lock our door after servicing the room.
reviews.title: Not quite as good as thinks it is

reviews.text: However despite these gripes, the hotel is beautiful. We had a lagoon spa room with a luxurious outdoor spa bath (a little bit public though as only half the balcony is shielded and we were on ground level). Pools are superb and concierges are very helpful with tour bookings. Restaurants nearby are excellent and much cheaper than in the ridiculously expensive Port Douglas.
reviews.title: A wonderful hotel

reviews.text: The three hotel restaurants (Thai, Italian and Australian) are excellent although a bit pricey. I would recommend trying one of the ones just a few yards away.
reviews.title: Great hotel, fantastic pool

reviews.text: Overall we enjoyed our stay here but it wasn't quite the highlight we were hoping for.
reviews.title: Only one word - excellent!

reviews.text: Stayed at the Outrigger for a few days to celebrate our wedding anniversary in late December. We were very happy on the whole - the rooms may not be very big but they are very comfortable and nicely decorated - we were very happy. The bathroom was very nicely designed and the balcony with spa (ie jacuzzi bath) was huge. The lagoon pool was great -very important since it was jelly fish season so no sea swimming. Yes, there are quite a few kids but there is also another pool which is a bit quieter. The other pool was called the Tranquility or Serenity Pool but despite the name that doesn't mean that children aren't actually allowed, which is a shame. It might be a good idea to make that one child-free since the main pool is more geared towards families. The service was fine but our only complaint was the limited times for eating. The pool side menu was not available late afternoon and at that time it was too early for dinner. Dinner ends around 9.30 and we were caught out when we wanted to eat around 10.00. Most restaurants in Palm Cove were closing then and we had to order room service which was also operating on a very minimal menu after 10.00 pm. The four restaurants in front of the hotel are not actually part of the hotel, only one of them. Nunu was very good, as was Vivo (further down the main street). The restaurant at the Angsana is nice - the only one right on the beach as there is no road in between but the food is not quite as good as Nunu.
reviews.title: Loved it!

reviews.text: I would definitely recommend a stay at the Outrigger as it is a really good price for the quality you get.
reviews.title: From a Young Couple

reviews.text: We stayed three nights in midMay at the Outrigger as part of our grand tour around eastern Australia. We had a great time and really enjoyed the hotel and the little community of Palm Cove. We felt especially lucky that the Outrigger seemed in fine shape unlike some of the other places along the strip which still had tarps and other construction in front. There is a pretty beach just in front of the hotel, the rooms are beautifully decorated and equipped, the staff is friendly and the swim-up bar the best! One night we ate at one of the four hotel restaurants, Bella Baci, and another night down the street at Colonies in the esplanade. Both were excellent.
reviews.title: Loved the Outrigger
Palm Cove great Outrigger average
reviews.text: Palm Cove is a great little place, very relaxed great beaches and nice restaurants. The Outrigger Pool and public areas including gardens all reflect a five star hotel. However, out suite was a little on the dirty side, dusty and badly cleaned. It’s a shame that that this let the Outrigger down because on the surface it is a great Hotel. The rooms afre well appointed and staff very friendly. I would echo the comments of other guests regarding the privacy of the Spa.

reviews.title: Outrigger Rudeness
reviews.text: We did complain about the dust etc in the room and a promise of a VIP clean never materialised.
The pool areas on the other hand are great, cleaned as you would expect twice a day, but the furniture was ready for maintenance.
reviews.title: Loved our stay...incredible hotel, restaurants and pool!!!
This resort is truly a resort!!!!!!!
reviews.text: We had no issues with Palm Cove, or the position of the Outrigger. The road in front is minor, and the Resort only a few metres from the nice beach. Palm Cove has a friendly atmosphere and unlike Cairns feels classy.

reviews.title: The Outrigger
reviews.text: We stayed at The Outrigger late August and thought it was a fabulous resort. We booked a 2 bedroom apartment with a spa on the balcony but it was booked thru private management not The Outrigger (Holidays Palm Cove) They have their own cleaners and someone to show you around when you arrive. The resort itself was beautiful, the gardens and public areas immaculately maintained. There were people constantly sweeping and gardening outside. The staff were friendly and always said hello when they saw you and the tour desk was very helpful. Our room was cleaned every 3 days and was immaculate. We also had extras provided with the room such as pool toys for kids, DVD's, CD's, books, tennis raquets, fishing gear, games etc.

Please note that The Outrigger group have recently been bought out by Peppers/Bale so management will change and from what I heard for the better. There are three pools, one large lagoon pool with sandy beach which is wonderful for kids, a large warmer pool and a peaceful rainforest pool. The location is also perfect right across the quiet road from the beach.
reviews.title: Excellent in all Respects

likes.liked: — Free internet access in business center

reviews.text: Stayed three nights in a two-bedroom ocean-view suite, and we were very pleased with our choice. We were somewhat nervous about our choice due to some bad reviews here, but all the properties we checked out seemed to have some bad reviews... In any case, we had no complaints at all about our stay. We arrived early, but our suite was ready for us, and the fridge had already been stocked with our groceries (they'll shop for you for a $15 AUD service charge; well worth it). Our luggage (lots of it, as we were concluding a 6 week trip) was whisked up to our suite immediately, no small task as there are no elevators. The suite was very large (about 1200 sq. ft), very clean, and nicely furnished (though you would never confuse it for a four seasons; more of a casual beach atmosphere). The balcony had a hot tub overlooking the ocean. The beds were comfortable, and the kitchen well-equipped. The hotel pools were beautiful, and the location is great; right across from a beautiful beach.
reviews.title: Good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have wanted to stay at this resort for a few years now so I booked a one night stay at the end of a Port Douglas trip last week.
reviews.title: Loved Palm Cove but not the Outrigger

likes.disliked: — Not clean enough and too many children

reviews.title: Fantastic Top Class
reviews.text: We had a spa room in the Serenity wing (quiet area no children) it overlooked the rainforest pool, see photos. The room was clean, nicely presented and exactly what I had wanted and was really quiet overnight.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I spent three days at the Outrigger and came away somewhat less than impressed. The hotel bills itself as a five-star property, but we found that to be an exaggeration. The "spa room" was very small and the pool was the only impressive part of the property. The picture on the hotel Web site indicates a luxurious facade, but it seemed rather faded in reality. For the price we paid, I would have expected better. Hotel restaurants were exhorbitantly priced, but there are alternatives within walking distance of the hotel. On a positive note, staff were very helpful and friendly, and went out of their way to be of assistance.
reviews.title: Not Quite 5 Star

reviews.text: People at neighboring restaurants and tour operators were also quite accommodating, and Palm Cove itself is a laid-back place where one can just relax. Upon arrival, however, we found that there was a jelly fish infestation that affected most of the north coast. There was an area of the beach protected by nets to keep out the jelly fish, but even the front desk clerk advised us to stick to the pool. Somehow this fact didn't make it into any of the promotional material posted by the hotel or Queensland tourism organizations.
reviews.title: Beautiful grounds, spacious apartments, maids not clean very well!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The high point of our stay was a snorkeling excursion to the Great Barrier Reef provided by Reef Cruises, the last locally owned and operated reef boat company. I would recommend them highly and use them again if we return to the area.
reviews.title: Loved it!

reviews.text: I thought the hotel was very nice, beautiful grounds and pool. The apartments were spacious. My only quibble, like some of the past reviews was the maid service. I should have reported it to management. When we arrived, the shower drain still had hair in it. And they never cleaned the shower while we were there. This is unacceptable...I am sure there are cleaning products available that sanitize without too much odor. I don't understand why they did not have an exhaust fan in the bathrooms. Plus, I was about to call management because of dead bugs on the floors, even after the maid had cleaned our room. Although it was taken care of the next day.
reviews.title: Family with young'uns=Yes, Anyone else=No

likes.liked: — Relatively convenient for getaways to Daintree, Barrier Reef
likes.disliked: — Not at all geared for my life

reviews.title: Enjoyed our stay at Outrigger Palm Cove
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Outrigger in November for 4 nights during our honeymoon and loved every aspect of the hotel. We had one of the penthouse suites over by the "rainforest" pool which was more private and quiet than the rest of the resort, which made it perfect for us.

description: This idyllic intimate beachfront destination is situated at the start of the beautiful coastal drive and only 20 minutes from Cairns airport. Peppers Beach Club & Spa comprises of 196 elegant suites and spa rooms, with styles ranging from private one bedroom accommodation to luxurious two bedroom penthouses with private rooftop terraces featuring a lounge, BBQ and private pool or heated Jacuzzi. Suites also feature stunning beachfront or lagoon views and fully equipped kitchens.
